author: Robert Fripp

thought: When a record company makes a mistake, the artist pays for it. When the artist makes a mistake, the artist pays for it.
author: Robert Fripp

thought: The artist has one career. The manager has as many careers as they have artists. The record company has as many careers as it has artists.
author: Robert Fripp

thought: The road to success is always under construction.
author: Anton Figg

thought: Art is the opposite of chaos. Art is organized chaos.
author: Igor Stravinsky

thought: When you make your peace with authority, you become an authority.
author: Jim Morrison

thought: Whoever controls the media, controls the mind.
author: Jim Morrison

thought: If you choose not to decide, you still have made a choice.
author: Neil Peart

thought: If you didn't have the valleys, you wouldn't know about the mountains.
author: Maurice Gibb

thought: I've never known a musician who regretted being one. Whatever deceptions life may have in store for you, music itself is not going to let you down.
author: Virgil Thompson

thought: Everything that has a beginning has an end. Everything with no beginning will have no end.
author: Marco Shepherd

thought: Everything that we see has a limit, except for our thoughts.
author: Marco Shepherd

thought: It's not what you play, it's how you play it.
author: Mary Lou Williams

thought: Nothing in music is hard, just unfamiliar.
author: Kenny Werner

thought: Too many pieces of music finish too long after the end.
author: Igor Stravinsky

thought: The moment we believe that success is determined by an ingrained level of ability as opposed to resilience and hard work, we will be brittle in the face of adversity.
author: Josh Waitzkin

thought: Notes are an intelligent way of moving from one silence to another.
author: Jim Hall

thought: You aren't remembered for doing what is expected of you.
author: Atul Chitnis

thought: Sometimes it is the artist's task to find out how much music you can still make with what you have left.

author: Robert Fulghum

author: Ornette Coleman

author: Ludwig van Beethoven

thought:
Institutions treat us as parts of a machine. They assign us ranks and place considerable pressure on us to fulfill our defined roles. We need something to help us restore our lost or distorted humanity.

Each of us has suppressed feelings that have built up, a voiceless cry in the depths of our souls, waiting for expression. Art, both in practice and appreciation, gives those feelings voice and form.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

thought:

thought: I play guitar because it lets me dream out loud.

thought: If you don't say it, don't write it.
author: Jason Blume

thought: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

thought: A painter paints his pictures on canvas. But musicians paint their pictures on silence. We provide the music, and you provide the silence.
author: Leopold Stokowski

thought:
Among the many forms in which human spirit has tried to express its innermost yearnings and perceptions, music is perhaps the most universal.

It symbolizes the yearning for harmony, with oneself and others, with nature and the spiritual and the sacred within us and around us.

There is something in music that transcends and unites. This is evident in the sacred music of every community - music that expresses the universal yearning that is shared by people all over the globe.
author: Dalai Lama

thought: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

thought: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
author: Pablo Picasso

thought: Better to do something imperfectly than to do nothing flawlessly.
author: Robert H. Schuller

thought: What would you attempt to do if you knew you could not fail?
author: Robert H. Schuller

thought: A city without music is a dead city.
author: African proverb

thought: Music is not sound. Music is using sound to organize emotions in time.
author: Krystian Zimerman

thought:
Close the door. Write with no one looking over your shoulder.

Don’t try to figure out what other people want to hear from you. Figure out what you have to say. It’s the one and only thing you have to offer.

thought: Politicians speak to the mainstream.  Musicians speak to the bloodstream

author: Hannah Moore

thought: Some succeed because they are destined to, but most succeed because they are determined to.

thought:

But the pauses between the notes, that is where the art resides.
author: Artur Schnabel

thought: Play with your eyes open.
author: Steven Page of Barenaked Ladies

thought:
What is full of redundancy or formula is predictably boring.

What is free of all structure or discipline is randomly boring.

In between lies art.

thought: Learn to be silent. Let your quiet mind listen and absorb.

thought: Music should never be harmless.

thought: All the sounds of the earth are like music.
author: Oscar Hammerstein

thought: Where words fail, music speaks.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

thought: It's easy to play any musical instrument.  All you have to do is touch the right key at the right time and the instrument will play itself.
author: J.S. Bach

thought: The scariest moment in writing is just before you start.
author: Stephen King

thought: Calling the product music is like selling a shopping cart and calling it groceries.
author: David Byrne

thought: Arrange whatever pieces come your way.
author: Virginia Woolf

thought: I try to write something where I know I'm the only person who can write it.
author: Paul Craft

thought: Once you get to a certain level of craftmanship, then inspiration becomes your key.
author: Eric Klein

thought: A songwriter's supreme challenge is being complex and simple at the same time.
author: Paul Simon

thought: All art constantly aspires toward the condition of music.
author: Walter Pater

thought:
Art is individualism, and individualism is a disturbing and disintegrating force.

There lies its immense value. For what it seeks is to disturb monotony of type, slavery of custom, tyranny of habit, and the reduction of man to the level of a machine.
author: Oscar Wilde

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

thought: Before anything, ask yourself, "What do I want to have happen?"
author: James Lee Stanley

thought: It's not where you take things from - it's where you take them to.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

thought: Write fearlessly!
author: Pat Pattison

thought: Who looks outside, dreams. Who looks inside, awakens.
author: Carl Jung

thought: The shorter way to do many things is to do only one thing at a time.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

thought: Do not let what you can't do interfere with what you can do.
author: John Wooden

thought: If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer.  Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.
author: Henry David Thoreau

thought: Just keep on going, straight ahead.
author: Ted Dunbar

thought: Perfection is attained, not when no more can be added, but when no more can be removed.
author: Atonie de Saint Exupéry

thought: Change the way you look at things, and the things you look at change.
author: Wayne Dyer

thought: Use what talents you possess: the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
author: Henry Van Dyke

thought: Art should never try to be popular. The public should try to make itself artistic.
author: Oscar Wilde

thought: Art is not what you see but what you make others see.
author: Edgar Degas

thought: Inspiration does exist, but it must find you working
author: Pablo Picasso

thought: An artist cannot fail. It is a success just to be one.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

thought: A genius is the one most like himself.
author: Thelonious Monk

thought: Music is the shorthand of emotion.
author: Leo Tolstoy

thought: Lyrics settle on a melody like dust on furniture.
author: Jeff Tweedy (Wilco)

thought: Destiny is not a matter of chance, it is a matter of choice. It is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.
author: William Jennings Bryan

thought: If you don't make a mistake, you're not trying hard enough.
author: Charlie Parker

thought: Go at it boldly, and you'll find unexpected forces coming to your aid.
author: Basil King

thought: Those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

thought: Art is never finished, only abandoned.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

thought:
The rest of the band will follow me down any dark alley. Sometimes there's a light at the end of the alley, and sometimes there's a black hole.

You don't get an adventure in music unless you're willing to take chances.
author: Jerry Garcia

thought: Writing about music is like dancing about architecture.
author: Elvis Costello

thought:
The real artist has no pride. Unfortunately he sees that his art has no limits. He feels obscurely how far he is from the goal.

While he is perhaps being admired by others, he mourns the fact that he has not yet reached the point to which his better genius, like a distant sun, ever beckons to him.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

thought: Forget all the chords on your guitar but three, and don't use the third one unless you have to.
author: Hank Williams

thought: A man's either an artist or a flat tire.
author: Charles Bukowski

thought: The twelve notes in each octave and the varieties of rhythm offer me opportunities that all of human genius will never exhaust.
author: Igor Stravinsky

thought: The size of the writer's block is usually in direct proportion to the distance between your ass and your chair.
author: Pat Pattison

thought:
An amateur practices something until he gets it right.

A professional practices until he can't get it wrong!
author: unknown

thought: No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings.
author: William Blake

thought: Creativity is making mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
author: Scott Adams

thought: We rely more on enthusiasm than actual skill. Whatever you do, do it enthusiastically and people will like it more.
author: Chris Martin from Coldplay

thought:
Someone told Chet Atkins, "Man, that guitar sure sounds good!"

Chet set the guitar down on a chair and asked him, "Ok, how does it sound now?"
author: Chet Atkins

thought: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
author: Erich Fromm

thought: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
author: Aldous Huxley

thought: Music should strike fire from the heart of man, and bring tears form the eyes of woman.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

thought: Words have the power to destroy or heal. When they are both true and kind, they can change the world.
author: Buddha

thought: Musical modes are nowhere altered without changes in the most important laws of the state.
author: Damon of Athens

thought: Promoting yourself is like adding links to a chain. When one opportunity is over, make sure it has the potential to lead to another.
author: Tyrone Wells

thought:
Just write.  It's not about sitting around waiting for the muse.

The people who are really good labour over what they write.
author: Amy Ray

thought: Music was my refuge.  I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness.
author: Maya Angelou

thought: It isn't where you came from, it's where you're going that counts.
author: Ella Fitzgerald

thought: I don't try to sound like anyone but me anymore. If something is out of my element, I try to avoid it.
author: Norah Jones

thought: You're gonna have to learn to get out there in front of those cameras and hold your head up. Take charge when you're singing.
author: Patsy Cline

thought: When I sing, trouble can sit right on my shoulder and I don't even notice.
author: Sarah Vaughan

thought:
If a song's about something I've experienced or that could've happened to me it's good.

But if it's alien to me, I couldn't lend anything to it. Because that's what soul is all about.
author: Aretha Franklin

thought: Cherish forever what makes you unique, 'cuz you're really a yawn if it goes.
author: Bette Midler

thought:
The soul of rock 'n' roll is mistakes, and making mistakes work for you.

The people who shy away from mistakes and play it safe have no business playing rock 'n' roll.
author: Paul Westerberg

thought: If I could have convinced more slaves that they were slaves, I would have freed thousands more.
author: Harriet Tubman

thought: When your work speaks for itself, don't interrupt.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

thought: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
author: Salvador Dalí

thought: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

thought: It's not the plane - it's the pilot.
author: Chuck Yeager

thought: The planet is asleep and it's the fault of musicians who are untrue to themselves.
author: Sun Ra

thought: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeing new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

thought: If it is art, it is not for all, and if it is for all, it is not art.
author: Schoenberg

thought: If you don't know what discipline is, then you don't know freedom either.
author: Elvin Jones

thought: Purely by hard work, one can become an artist
author: Robert Fripp

thought: To compose is to remember music that has never been written.
author: Robert Schumann

thought: After playing Chopin, I feel as if I had been weeping over sins that I had never committed, and mourning over tragedies that were not my own.
author: Oscar Wilde

thought: If you take risk away from music and art, what are you left with? Toothpaste commercials.
author: Mika

thought: You have to suppress your own ambitions in order to be who you need to be.
author: Bob Dylan

thought: I’m not trying to play the guitar. I’m trying to play music.
author: Michael Hedges

thought: Music expresses that which cannot be said in words and on which it is impossible to be silent.
author: Victor Hugo

thought: You've got to find a way of saying it without saying it.
author: Duke Ellington

thought: Every noise, when listened to carefully, becomes music.
author: Anushya Kumar

thought: Most people miss opportunity because it is dressed in overalls, and looks like hard work.
author: Thomas Edison

thought: My music is a lullaby I write to myself to make sense of things I can't tie together, things I've lost, or things I'll never have.
author: Stephan Jenkins

thought: Songs are time machines of our generations, they take you right back to where you were in your life when you first heard them.
author: Steve Almond

thought: I am the combined effort of everyone I've ever known
author: Chuck Palahniuk

thought: The trouble with life is that there’s no background music.
author: Philip R. Craig

thought: If you don’t make mistakes, you aren’t really trying.
author: Coleman Hawkins

thought: Art is a house that tries to be haunted.
author: Emily Dickinson

thought: To achieve great things, two things are needed: a plan, and not quite enough time
author: Leonard Bernstein

thought: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.
author: Chinese Proverb

thought: Beauty in music is too often confused with something that lets the ears lie back in an easy chair.
author: Charles Ives

thought: Writing about writer's block is better than not writing at all.
author: Charles Bukowski
